snippet: The party is not as united as it was four years ago, but Democrats are finding common purpose in denying Republicans control of the White House and Congress next year.
abstract: Political Memo; Democrats are not as unified and energized as in 2008, but they are finding common purpose in denying Republicans control of the White House and Congress; are preparing to nominate Pres Obama for a second term, driven by a sense of urgency to repel a conservative agenda that could unravel much of what the party has stood for for decades; even if Obama defeats Mitt Romney, questions remain over whether he will have a strong enough mandate for an ambitious second term.
lead_paragraph: The party is not as united as it was four years ago, but Democrats are finding common purpose in denying Republicans control of the White House and Congress next year.

headline.seo: Lacking Spirit of ’08, Democrats Still Find Reason to Unite
headline.main: Spirit of ’08 Gone, Democrats Reunite Against G.O.P. Threat
headline.print_headline: Spirit of ’08 Gone, Democrats Reunite Against G.O.P. Threat
